name: dovecot
description: Dovecot is a widely used open-source IMAP and POP3 email server focused on security and performance. It runs as a daemon on Unix-like systems, providing mailbox storage, authentication, and extensible plugins for mail infrastructures.
features: IMAP and POP3: Retrieve email from mailboxes using standard protocols compatible with all major mail clients.
High performance: Handle thousands of concurrent connections with efficient indexing and caching for fast mailbox access.
Flexible authentication: Support multiple backends including LDAP, SQL databases, and PAM for user verification.
Mailbox formats: Store messages in Maildir, mbox, or dbox formats with automatic conversion and migration tools.
Sieve filtering: Process incoming mail with server-side rules for sorting, forwarding, and automated responses.
Plugin architecture: Extend functionality with modules for quota management, full-text search, and replication.
Security hardening: Run with minimal privileges and support TLS encryption to protect credentials and message content.
Quota enforcement: Limit mailbox sizes per user or domain with configurable warnings and rejection policies.
